original: FAHLBECK, Felix Erik, Professor, Stockholm, f Lund 23/5 93 av prof Pontus F o frih :an Alice von Willebrand, gm Gertrud Silfverstolpe. Jur kand 19, tingstjg 19—22, fil d:r 25, doc i statskunsk v StHS 29. Tf prof i stats- o för-valtn.rätt i Upps 38—41, prof i förvaltn.rätt o statsrätt m. folkrätt i Lund fr 1/7 44. Vkst dir i Handöls Nya Täljstens- & Vattenkrafts AB fr 23. Styr.led där fr 19, i Skattebetalarnas Frn, led av överstyr f Försäkr AB Valand mm. Stdsflm i Djursholm 21—33 samt led av fi kommunala styr där. Ordf i Istfrn. Av trycket: Ett flert jurid o statsvetenskanl arb. RFinlVROlkl, RFFrK3kl mfl
translated: FAHLBECK, Felix Erik, Professor, Stockholm, born in Lund on May 23, 1893, son of Professor Pontus F and Friherre Alice von Willebrand, married to Gertrud Silfverstolpe. Completed a law degree in 1919, served as a judge from 1919 to 1922, obtained a PhD in Political Science from Stockholm University in 1925, and became a docent in Political Science at the University of Stockholm in 1929. Acting professor in Administrative Law in Uppsala from 1938 to 1941, appointed professor in Administrative Law and Constitutional Law with International Law in Lund from July 1, 1944. Also served as the managing director of Handöls Nya Täljstens- & Vattenkrafts AB since 1923, and a board member there since 1919. Additionally, a member of Skattebetalarnas Frn board, chairperson of Istfrn, and a member of the governing board of Försäkr AB Valand, among other positions. Resided in Djursholm from 1921 to 1933 and served on the local municipal council. Written various legal and political science works. Decorated with the Royal Order of Vasa, the Royal Order of the Sword, and the Royal Order of the Polar Star, among others.

structured.name: Felix Erik Fahlbeck

memberOf.name: Royal Order of the Polar Star

structured.description: Felix Erik Fahlbeck, born on May 23, 1893 in Lund, Sweden, was a professor in Stockholm. He was the son of Professor Pontus Fahlbeck and Friherre Alice von Willebrand. Felix was married to Gertrud Silfverstolpe. He completed his law degree in 1919 and served as a judge from 1919 to 1922. In 1925, he obtained a Ph.D. in Political Science from Stockholm University and became a docent in Political Science at the University of Stockholm in 1929. From 1938 to 1941, he held the position of acting professor in Administrative Law at Uppsala University. On July 1, 1944, he was appointed as a professor in Administrative Law and Constitutional Law with International Law at Lund University. Alongside his academic career, Felix also held various positions such as managing director of Handöls Nya Täljstens- & Vattenkrafts AB since 1923, board member of the same organization since 1919, board member of Skattebetalarnas Frn, chairperson of Istfrn, and board member of Försäkr AB Valand's governing board, among other roles. He resided in Djursholm from 1921 to 1933 and was actively involved in local municipality affairs. Felix Erik Fahlbeck received several honors, including the Royal Order of Vasa, the Royal Order of the Sword, and the Royal Order of the Polar Star.

career.occupational_title: Professor in Administrative Law and Constitutional Law with International Law
